page.title: 11The River Medina.
page.content: The River Medina is the main river in the Isle of Wight. It roughly bisects the island, hence the name. It rises in the south of the island near Chale Green and flows through the Wilderness and on to Newport the main town.There is a quay at Newport where boats come in. The river flows into The Solent at Cowes.We measured the river on the map and it is approximately 10.5 miles (17 Km.) There is a new Industrial Estate by the river and the remains of the old railway sidings and cement mills. There is an old jetty where farmers now store grain in a silo and cement and coal are landed from barges coming up the river. The river is popular for leisure activities including sailing, rowing,fishing and relaxing along the banks.
